title: List of science fiction films of the 2010s
html:
List of science fiction films of the 2010s

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Jump to navigation Jump to search

This is a list of science fiction films release in the 2010s. These films include core elements of science fiction, but can cross into other genres. They have been released to a cinema audience by the commercial film industry and are widely distributed with reviews by reputable critics.

This film-related list is incomplete; you can help by adding missing items. (October 2021)

Contents

  • 1 Listing
  • 2 See also
  • 3 Notes
  • 4 References

Notes[edit]

  1. ^ Awarded Best Production Design, Best Special Visual Effects and Best Sound at the 64th British Academy Film Awards. It was nominated for Best Film, Best Cinematography, Best Director, Best Editing, Best Music and Best Original Screenplay.
    At the 83rd Academy Awards, Inception received Oscars for Best Cinematography, Best Sound Editing, Best Sound Mixing and Best Visual Effects. It was nominated for Best Art Direction, Best Music (Original Score), Best Picture and Best Writing (Original Screenplay).
    At the 37th Annual Saturn Awards, Inception received awards for Best Science Fiction Film, Best Director, Best Writer, Best Music, and Best Special Effects. It was nominated for Best Actor, Best Actress, Best Supporting Actor, and Best Production Design.
  2. ^ Released theatrically in Japan on December 1.
  3. ^ Only released theatrically in the Middle East and Southeast Asia.
  4. ^ At the 39th Annual Saturn Awards, The Avengers received awards for Best Science Fiction Film, Best Director, Best Supporting Actor, and Best Special Effects. It was nominated for Best Writing and Best Editing.
  5. ^ Saturn Awards for Best Editing and Best Make-up
  6. ^ Won a Saturn Award for Best Actress

paragraphs.text: This is a list of science fiction films release in the 2010s. These films include core elements of science fiction, but can cross into other genres. They have been released to a cinema audience by the commercial film industry and are widely distributed with reviews by reputable critics.
